snippet: Bernard Labadie led the New York Philharmonic on Friday in a performance of Mozart’s Requiem, relying on Robert Levin’s idiomatically sensitive edition of the work.
abstract: Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim reviews performance by New York Philharmonic at Avery Fisher Hall.
lead_paragraph: Bernard Labadie led the New York Philharmonic on Friday in a performance of Mozart’s Requiem, relying on Robert Levin’s idiomatically sensitive edition of the work.

headline.seo: New York Philharmonic Performs Mozart’s Requiem
headline.main: A Lively Requiem, Without the What-if-He’d Lived
headline.print_headline: A Lively Requiem, Without the What-if-He’d Lived
